bkietz commented on pull request #6214: ARROW-7593: [CI][Python] Python datasets failing / not run on CI
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6214#discussion_r367462809
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/_dataset.pyx
 ##########
 @@ -633,7 +633,7 @@ cdef class FileSystemDataSource(DataSource):
         CFileSystemDataSource* filesystem_source
 
     def __init__(self, Schema schema not None,
-                 Expression source_partition not None,
+                 Expression source_partition,
 
 Review comment:
   You'll need to properly handle the case where `source_partition == None`; IIUC this will pass a nullptr to C++. The default should be `scalar(true)`

bkietz commented on pull request #6214: ARROW-7593: [CI][Python] Python datasets failing / not run on CI
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6214#discussion_r367462809
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/_dataset.pyx
 ##########
 @@ -633,7 +633,7 @@ cdef class FileSystemDataSource(DataSource):
         CFileSystemDataSource* filesystem_source
 
     def __init__(self, Schema schema not None,
-                 Expression source_partition not None,
+                 Expression source_partition,
 
 Review comment:
   You'll need to properly handle the case where `source_partition == None`; IIUC this will pass a nullptr to C++ which is not supported.
   
   ```python
           if source_partition is None:
               source_partition = ScalarExpression(True)
           c_source_partition = source_partition.unwrap()
   ```
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

jorisvandenbossche commented on issue #6214: ARROW-7593: [CI][Python] Python datasets failing / not run on CI
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6214#issuecomment-575195814
 
 
   > ARROW_DATASET should be set from the docker images
   
   I did that (I think, all *cpp + the yml workflows). But I still think there is something wrong in the logic of python inferring when to build the dataset library. In principle when cpp is building with python, you don't need to set ARROW_DATASET manually (this is done by cmake for you). But then the python build script will not detect this correctly to build pyarrow.dataset.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

jorisvandenbossche commented on issue #6214: ARROW-7593: [CI][Python] Python datasets failing / not run on CI
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6214#issuecomment-575215078
 
 
   > You mean we should implicitly build the python bindings based on the available arrow libraries?
   
   In C++, datasets is automatically built when python is built. But in Python, datasets is not automatically built. That seems a bit like a mismatch. 
   
   I don't know if there are use cases to *not* build datasets in python? (eg can you in C++ override cmake rules to not build datasets but do build python?) 
   Other modules that are in C++ enabled when building python (eg CSV, JSON, FILESYSTEM), they are all always built in Python, we don't have `PYARROW_WITH_..` for those.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

users@infra.apache.org
